Description: Body fragment of East Greek pottery closed vessel, oenochoe or amphora. Below band with added red band lined in white a lotus and bud frieze.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The frieze of buds and lotuses at the equator of the vessel is unusual, but compare the Late Wild Goat amphora Berlin 2930 (Kardara, p.283 no.1 and pl.14a; Samos 6.1, pl.130 no.1043) and catalogue no.21 below. The added white and red on the bands separating the friezes are common in Late Wild Goat.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 8, no. 9 pl. 5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.917)
